creator: gbz@hey.shacknet.nu
text:
I read that some web server can check the Last-Modified header provided from a
SSI script, and compare it to the If-Modified-Since header provided by the client.
If needed, it will then automatically return a 304/Not Modified response.
Can this be a feature of Apache too?

In Apache httpd, SSI pages don't even send a Last-Modified unless XBitHack full
is set.

If the last-modified header is sent, I believe a 304 will also be sent when
appropriate.
creator: slive@apache.org
